title: Id Anthology online manual.
content:
Id Anthology came with a manual and it covers all seven keen games.

Is it alright if I put it up here as a download?

Also if I buy the commander keen combo CD from 3D realms, does it have a manual on the CD too?

title: Re: Id Anthology online manual.
content:
I think I read that the Keen combo CD from 3DR just has the games on it and nothing else. I don't actually own a copy, so who knows... that info could be incorrect.

As for the Id Anthology's manual, I think that's alright if you scan and upload the Keen bit. The other Keen manuals are uploaded somewhere and no authories have demanded they be taken down.

title: Re: Id Anthology online manual.
content:
Well, this manual is more like a .EXE that came on the CD.

The Id Anthology manual includes story, hints, tips, passwords, more stuff, for all 19 games and the game manuals are viewed with omoplay.

So there's no scanning to be done except for 'The Book of id' a book that is a part of the 4cd case, thats also worth something to see if you cant buy Id Anthology.

title: re
content: Yeah its fine, go ahead.

title: re upload?
content:
I have to e-mail it to some one to get it uploaded.

Who will gladly host it for me?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] Confused!

A manual not a game.

Do you not want it with the installer?

Where are the rules for this?

I dont know.....

title: Re: lol
content:
Ooh, I'm interested in this! [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]

An exe is still a program. Whether it's copyright is another question.

Check the readme for copyright restrictions, and when it isn't illegal to be uploaded, you can send it to me too. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-wink.gif[/img] ____________

title: Copywrite error.
content:
TITLE: VINTAGE GAME COLLECTION FOR ID ANTHOLOGY
BUILD#: 2
DATE: 11/20/96


There nothing illegal about it that I can see.

Nothing illegal here.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

Well, the only error I can think of is OMOPLAY not knowing where the MANUAL.STA file is.

Istalling it just puts it on your hard drive and puts a shortcut in the all programs list, the shortcut runs OMOPLAY and MANUAL.STA.


[center] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] [/center]

title: Copyright legal to distribute.
content:
Ok.

The only copyrights I can find in this manual is about a doom FAQ and copyright 1996 GT Interactive.

There's nothing in it about being illegal to distribute.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]


[center] [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-barf.gif[/img] [/center]

title: Movie Problem I Guess....Runtime Error.
content:
I said it would work work no matter what but not if it's a problem like this.

Now I feel stupid.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sick.gif[/img]

OMORUN caused a General Protection Fault in module OMOPLAY.EXE at 000C:8512

When I run this on my computer (WinXP) I get an error.


Movie Object Initialization

QTW Initialization Error: 1. Is it installed?


After that it just runs it normally, with no problem.

I knew the first two I sent were bad copys but not this one, the first two weren't right. (I thought that was your problem)

I don't know.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-oops.gif[/img]

QTW!!

Quick Time Window.

I don't use Quick time so i've never seen the movie.

I also think it needs a older quick time to see it.

So your problem is with that movie I guess.

Is there another computer you can run it on. (it works)

Also look at this [url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/General_protection_fault]- General Protection Fault -[/url]

Runtime error.....[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img]

title: Re: Movie Problem I Guess....Runtime Error.
content: If it's just text in the manual that mentions Keen, maybe you could just retype it here or something.

title: Re: Movie Problem I Guess....Runtime Error.
content:
Yeah, or take a screen shot..3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."

title: Download it.
content:
Take a screen shot.....[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img]

There's a reason why its a .EXE file, thats way too much text to copy, I was thinking about copying 'The Book of id' to text and posting it here.

The manual works, there's no problem with that so....

[url=http://alexn.freepgs.com/ID_ANTH.zip]Download it[/url].[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-grin.gif[/img]

I tested it on windows XP and 98.

Runtime errors suck.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-annoyed.gif[/img]:">

I don't know why it wont work on alex87 computer.

Does anyone here know what's wrong?

title: Re: Download it.
content:
Yeah, probably old hardware commands being called on modern hardware that can't support or emulate that specific hardware command, thus closes the app to stay safe from really big crashes or hardware explosions ([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] ).____________
Don't think of me as an ordinary man.

Even though I am an ordinary man.

Ah, [url=http://DaVince.sitesled.com/]site.[/url]

title: keen combo CD.
content:
I still have a unanswered question.

If I buy the combo CD from 3D realms does, it have a manual on the CD, like id anthology does, a EXE on the CD?

Also are the versions on the combo CD newer versions?

title: Re: keen combo CD.
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr][url=http://forums.3drealms.com/vb/showpost.php?p=234465&postcount=2]Joe Siegler[/url] It's got Keens Episodes 1-5 on it. It's got a Windows installer on the disc (as well as a DOS based one).

Games are the same ones we've been selling for about 15 years though - no update there.[hr][/quote]

That should answer it.

title: Re: keen combo CD.
content:
And now I know....

Not to buy it.

Just keen 1-5, thats all...Maybe it's a good thing I have id anthology.[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]
